messages: 1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (17:17): xtraeme: Remember that Apache MPM=worker problem? Maybe you know how it works now?
fef55334795c9ce155148d37e80baee8 (17:20): haven't tried, I can't remember exactly what was the problem...
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (17:23): xtraeme: Apache modules was linked somehow differently and could not be loaded (unexecpected symbols, IIRC).
c92b2535284b6cd2d35ae571dc72fd52 (17:25): Unex: ?Is it trying to run a multithreaded module in a single-thread apache build
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (17:27): yukonbob_: I think the other way round :)
c92b2535284b6cd2d35ae571dc72fd52 (17:28): Unex: that doesn't make sense... if apache supports threads, why would it matter if the module didn't utilize them?
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (17:35): yukonbob: Well, we need to go deep into the Apache's architecture. It depends on how Apache and module interacts, thought.
11dcbf8105451bb7a15317b15a0e60f1 (17:36): I just threw that out because it stumped me for a while, and the notes for build-options fly by (if you're even looking ;)
1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (17:38): yukonbob: So it is still not working? I did not try MPM=worker at current time.

11dcbf8105451bb7a15317b15a0e60f1 (17:46): Unex: mine is alright now... and as I look at my pkgsrc-current (just updated) I see there's no option for building single/multithreaded... perhaps a non-issue now ?

1671f6bd3bcf7f834512fc2d93e7fab6 (17:55): yukonbob: What do you mean "single"? The default "perfork" option uses simple UNIX forks for each process. The "worker" option uses threads. You can set it with APACHE_MPM option.
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (18:05): if i toggle the ".profile" i get another warning
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (18:05): how can i fix this?

f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (18:06): sjamaan, i have to run the security script to get that warning
